emails.subject: User email address enumeration vulnerability on kaup24.ee
emails.bodyHtml: Hello, During our research on user account enumeration flaws on Estonian online services, we found that your website is vulnerable to the exposure of registered user email addresses. The vulnerability report is attached. We would appreciate it if you could confirm receipt of this email to prevent us from reaching out to you through other channels. Best regards, Gregor Eesmaa Computer Science MSc student University of Tartu, Institute of Computer Science

Tere, nüüdsest olete veel rohkem kaitstud! Alates 25. maist jõustus uus Üldine andmekaitsemäärus seoses füüsiliste isikute andmete töötlemise kaitse ja selliste andmete vaba liikumisega. Oleme täitnud määruse sätted ja kindlustame Teie isikuandmete eriti läbipaistva ja ausa töötlemise. Tutvuge. Koostasime Teile lühikesed juhised, millest leiate vastused kõige sagedamini esitatavatele küsimustele seoses Teie isikuandmete töötlemisega. Samuti kutsume tutvuma uuendatud Privaatsuspoliitikaga. Tuletame meelde, et Te olete meile andnud enda nõusoleku Teie isikuandmete töötlemiseks ja kasutamiseks personaliseeritud ja üldpakkumiste esitamiseks seoses kaup24.ee poolt korraldatavate loteriide, kampaaniate, projektidega. Kuna Te olete andnud enda nõusoleku määruse jõustumisel, ei pea Te lisatoiminguid tegema. Enda nõusolekut seoses Teie isikuandmete töötlemisega saate igal ajal korrigeerida, sisenedes enda isiklikule kaup24.ee kontole või võttes ühendust kaup24.ee‘ga telefoni teel +372 646 8107 või e-posti teel: andmekaitse@kaup24.ee

emails.subject: User email address enumeration vulnerability on kaup24.ee
emails.bodyHtml: Hello, During our research on user account enumeration flaws on Estonian online services, we found that your website is vulnerable to the exposure of registered user email addresses. The vulnerability report is attached. We would appreciate it if you could confirm receipt of this email to prevent us from reaching out to you through other channels. Best regards, Gregor Eesmaa Computer Science MSc student University of Tartu, Institute of Computer Science

emails.subject: Täname Teie kirja eest.
emails.bodyHtml:
Tere,

 

Täname Teid sõnumi eest.

Pange tähele, et meil on hetkel erakordselt palju klientide päringuid,
mistõttu vastame Teie küsimusele 5 tööpäeva jooksul.

Kui aga vajate vastust kiiremini, kirjutage meile läbi virtuaalse
assistendi aadressil https://kaup24.ee/et/kontaktid

Vabandame võimalike ebamugavuste pärast ja täname mõistva suhtumise eest.

 

DLB Trading OÜ | www.kaup24.ee

emails.subject: IKÜM taotlus seoses isikuandmete töötlemisega teenuses kaup24.ee / GDPR Request Regarding Processing of Personal Data on kaup24.ee
emails.bodyHtml: Lugupeetud kaup24.ee vastutav andmetöötleja Pöördun, et edastada ametlikult mure isikuandmete kaitse üldmääruse (IKÜM) alusel seoses minu isikuandmete töötlemisega teenuses kaup24.ee, mida pean ebaseaduslikuks ning mis võib viia nende avaldamiseni selleks volitamata isikutele ilma selge õigusliku aluseta. Manuses on ametlik taotlus, milles teostan oma õigusi IKÜM artiklite 15, 18 ja 21 alusel. Palun selle läbivaatust ja vastavate meetmete võtmist ajaraamis, mis on sätestatud IKÜM artiklis 12(3) (üks kuu taotluse saamisest). Palun teavitage taotluse kättesaamisest. Lugupidamisega Gregor Eesmaa -- Dear Data Controller of kaup24.ee, I am contacting you to formally raise concerns under the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) regarding what I believe to be the unlawful processing of my personal data by kaup24.ee, potentially leading to its disclosure to unauthorised parties without a clear legal basis. Please find attached a formal application exercising my rights under Articles 15, 18, and 21 of the GDPR. I request that you review and act upon it accordingly, within the timeframe established by Article 12(3) of the GDPR (one month from receipt). Please confirm receipt of this request. Kind regards, Gregor Eesmaa

emails.subject: Re: IKÜM taotlus seoses isikuandmete töötlemisega teenuses kaup24.ee / GDPR Request Regarding Processing of Personal Data on kaup24.ee
emails.bodyHtml:
Saadan igaks juhuks ka eraldi taotluse ja aruande PDFid, mis asusid eelmise meili manuses digiallkirjastatud konteineris.

Lugupidamisega
Gregor Eesmaa

--

Just in case, providing also the request and the report PDF files, that were in the digitally signed container attached to the previous email.

Kind regards,
Gregor Eesmaa

emails.subject: Re: IKÜM taotlus seoses isikuandmete töötlemisega teenuses kaup24.ee / GDPR Request Regarding Processing of Personal Data on kaup24.ee [ thread::MVGOuUywOoyZY0MMMJUauiY:: ]
emails.bodyHtml:
Lugupeetud Gregor Eesmaa

Kinnitan, et oleme Teie taotluse kätte saanud ning vastame sellele hiljemalt 30 päeva jooksul.

Lugupidamisega
Merli/Kaup24

llmAnalysis.thinking:
**My Analysis of the GDPR Response**

Okay, so I've been given an email and asked to analyze it for GDPR compliance and translate the findings into a JSON object. Here's my thinking process:

First, I examined the email content. It's from Merli/Kaup24 to Gregor Eesmaa and is written in Estonian. The content is a standard acknowledgement of receiving a request, promising a response within 30 days. It uses formal language, which is typical for this kind of correspondence.  "Lugupeetud" and "Lugupidamisega" indicate formal greetings.

Given this, I started mapping the information to the JSON object's fields. The language is Estonian (`et`), and the formality is confirmed by the language, so `is_formal` is `true`.  The email *doesn't* address the substance of the GDPR requests (Article 15, 18, 21), so `addresses_request` is `no`.  It does contain personal data: the recipient's name ("Gregor Eesmaa") and the sender's name ("Merli"), meaning `personal_data` will contain those names. "Kaup24" is a company, so it's not personal data.

Crucially, the email isn't asking for an extension. It simply states they'll respond within the standard timeframe (one month). Therefore, `extension_explicitly_requested` is `false`, and the related fields, `extension_deadline` and `extension_reasons`, are `null`.

The email doesn't mention the vulnerability, legal basis, or business reasons, so `acknowledgement` is `"not_mentioned"`.  Similarly, `justification_explicit_article6_paragraph1_points`,  `justification_topics`, `remediation_status`, `remediation_scope`, and `remediation_finish_date` are all also set to `null`. There is no mention of remediation or justification for the delay.

Based on this analysis, I've constructed the following JSON object, accurately reflecting the nature of the email as a simple acknowledgement of receipt:

```json
{
  "languages": ["et"],
  "is_formal": true,
  "addresses_request": "no",
  "personal_data": ["Gregor Eesmaa", "Merli"],
  "extension_explicitly_requested": false,
  "extension_deadline": null,
  "extension_reasons": null,
  "acknowledgement": "not_mentioned",
  "justification_explicit_article6_paragraph1_points": null,
  "justification_topics": null,
  "remediation_status": "not_mentioned",
  "remediation_scope": "not_mentioned",
  "remediation_finish_date": null
}
```

This reflects a complete and accurate representation of the email content and its implications in the context of GDPR. It's a straightforward acknowledgement of receipt. I'm satisfied that this JSON accurately summarizes the email's content and its compliance aspects.

emails.subject: Kaup24.ee vastus taotlusele
emails.bodyHtml:
Lp Gregor Eesmaa

Lisatud failina saadab Dlb Trading OÜ (kaup24.ee) vastuse Teie 31.05.2025 taotlusele.

Kuna Teie taotlus oli koostatud nii eesti kui ka inglise keeles, otsustasime Teile vastata ka mõlemas keeles. Tõlke lahknevuste korral palun lähtuda eestikeelsest vastusest

Lugupidamisega
Anna Aida
Jurist | Lawyer
 
+372 55530479
anna.aida@kaup24.ee
Peterburi tee 2f, 11415 Tallinn, Estonia
 
PHH Group
phhgroup.eu | pigu.lt | 220.lv | kaup24.ee | hobbyhall.fi
 
Pange tähele, et käesolev e-kiri võib sisaldada konfidentsiaalset teavet. Juhul, kui olete saanud käesoleva teate ekslikult, siis palume teil sellest koheselt teavitada sõnumi saatjat e-kirja teel, seejärel kustutage sõnum oma süsteemist, ilma et teeksite, levitaksite või säilitaksite sellest koopiaid.
 
Please note that information in this message and its any attachments is confidential. If you have received this message by mistake, please inform the sender of the mistake and immediately delete the message from your system without making, distributing or retaining any copies of it.

llmAnalysis.thinking:
**Final JSON Object Generation: A Detailed Walkthrough**

My task is to meticulously analyze an email and its attached ODT file to generate a JSON object structured according to a pre-defined `Result` schema. This involves a comprehensive understanding of the email's content, the file's metadata, and the specific requirements of the schema.

First, I need to establish the foundational attributes of the communication. The **`languages`** used are definitively Estonian (`et`) and English (`en`), evident from both the email body and the bilingual nature of the attached file. The **`is_formal`** attribute is clearly `true`. The language, use of legal terminology ("Lp," "Lugupidamisega," "Dear," "Best regards"), and structure all point to a professional and formal exchange. The email directly addresses the data subject access request, so the **`addresses_request`** property is set to `"yes"` because the structure mirrors the requested GDPR articles 15, 18, and 21.

Next, I need to identify and extract any **`personal_data`**. From the email and metadata, I've identified several key pieces of PII: the recipient, "Gregor Eesmaa"; the sender/contact, "Anna Aida"; and her contact information – the phone number "+372 55530479" and the email address "anna.aida@kaup24.ee". It's important to differentiate this from company details. The address "Peterburi tee 2f, 11415 Tallinn, Estonia," the company name "Dlb Trading OÜ," and the generic email address "andmekaitse@kaup24.ee" are not personal data; they belong to the business entity.

The email doesn't contain a request for an **`extension_explicitly_requested`** which is `false`. It offers a response now and, therefore, the **`extension_deadline`** and **`extension_reasons`** are both `null`.

The analysis then moves to the heart of the matter: the company's response and acknowledgement of the issue. The **`acknowledgement`** property is set to `"partially_agree"`. While they concede that a "targeted identification possibility exists," they downplay its significance. They also frame the issue as a widespread, challenging problem, almost bordering on unsolvable.

Analyzing the justification involves understanding the legal basis for processing data. I've pinpointed the relevant **`justification_explicit_article6_paragraph1_points`** as `["b", "f"]`. They explicitly use Art. 6(1)(b) for contract fulfillment and Art. 6(1)(f) for legitimate interest. The justification topics also need to be determined. The **`justification_topics`** include: `"account_management"` (as per Art. 6(1)(b)), `"account_security"` (mentioned in 6(1)(f)), `"widespread_practice"` (per their explanation), and `"user_experience"` (in relation to spam prevention considerations).

For the remediation, the status and the planned fix must be analyzed. The **`remediation_status`** is `"in_progress"`. They have already implemented rate limiting, but a more comprehensive "permanent solution" is under development, indicating that the solution is not finished, and ongoing. The **`remediation_scope`** is `"unclear"` because, although they state a full fix is in the works, they repeatedly mention the complexity and difficulty of the problem. Thus, it is difficult to determine with complete certainty if the issue will be completely solved. The **`remediation_finish_date`** is set to `null` because the timeframe mentioned is vague ("lähitulevikus," or "near future").

Finally, a comprehensive review ensures all fields are accurate and reflect my thorough assessment. With all the required data collected and verified, I am now ready to generate the JSON object.
